entities.name: malfoy
entities.description: Malfoy is mentioned as sneering and making a comment about Granger's black eye. He is also referred to as 'my son' by his mother, indicating that he is the child of Narcissa Malfoy.

entities.name: granger
entities.description: Granger is mentioned as having a black eye and being the target of Malfoy's comment. She is also referred to by Harry, indicating that she is his friend or acquaintance.

entities.name: madam malkin
entities.description: Madam Malkin is mentioned as sharply telling Malfoy to stop and looking over her shoulder for support. She appears to be in a position of authority or at least trying to maintain order.

entities.name: narcissa malfoy
entities.description: Narcissa Malfoy is mentioned as strolling out from behind the clothes rack and telling Harry and Ron to put their wands away. She appears to be a mother who is protective of her son.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is mentioned as taking a step forwards and gazing into Malfoy's face. He is also referred to by Narcissa Malfoy, indicating that he is known to her.

entities.name: ron
entities.description: Ron is mentioned alongside Harry and told by Narcissa Malfoy to put his wand away. He appears to be a friend or acquaintance of Harry's.

relationships.description: Narcissa Malfoy is referred to as 'my son' by her mother, indicating that she is the parent of Malfoy.
Madam Malkin appears to be in a position of authority or at least trying to maintain order, and Narcissa Malfoy is referred to as being protected by her.
Harry is referred to by Granger, indicating that they are friends or acquaintances.
Narcissa Malfoy appears to know Harry and refers to him in a conversation with her son.
